e4: Though the current policy is profitable in the short term due to investor expectations, it is fundamentally unethical. The new policy prioritizes transparency and honesty, even if it causes temporary market uncertainty.  Building trust with investors through ethical practices will ultimately lead to a stronger, more sustainable company.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes honesty and transparency above all else. It presents financial information accurately and fairly, avoiding any deliberate misrepresentation or manipulation. Public companies have a responsibility to inform investors with clear and complete data, fostering trust and enabling sound decision-making.  This includes providing sufficient context for understanding reported figures and clearly disclosing any potential biases or limitations.
e6: Yes. I would want to understand their plan for communicating the new policy to investors and mitigating potential short-term confusion. It's crucial they have a strategy for transparently explaining the change and managing investor expectations.
